Summary: Gigantic black triangular craft, silent, 2000 feet overhead, hundreds of metres long and wide
trends: There have been 27 other sightings in Brisbane
There were no other sightings in Brisbane on or around October 15th 1989
divs: sighting detailsthis happened in the city of brisbane (population about 1.2 million) at the end of 1989. i was just finished a sports training session on an outdoor athletics track in toowong, a highly populated and developed inner suburb of brisbane. at the end of my training session i lay on the grass field on my back, stretching my legs and back and arms in the way i always had for almost a decade. it was already dark but there was sufficient light from nearby street lights for me to continue warming down and stretching on the grass before going home. as i lay on my back on the grass i looked up at the sky and saw it was completely black. it looked a little odd not to see anything at all, no stars, no clouds. just black. then i looked further toward the east, and noticed that there were stars in that direction. then i actually saw stars, first one or two, then several, then more and more, blinking to life in an organised way. like, blinking to life in turn. and then i realised that something huge and black was floating across the sky and was blotting out a very large slice of it. then i began to see the shape of this enormous black object, it was easily several times longer than the sports field, and three or four times wider. i saw that it had its own lights that were just about the same brightness of bright stars along its two leading edges. i didn't count how many of these lights there were but would guess 9 or 10, maybe more. as the object flew\floated overhead, heading west, it blotted out other stars immediately in front of it and they blinked out, just as the stars to the east were blinking on when the craft's end passed. it was an extraordinary couple of minutes. it may only have been one minute, but it seemed like it went on for a very long time. i was shocked by several things. 1) that it was so absolutely enormous. it was like watching a battleship, or a mountain, float in the sky. 2) that it was absolutely silent. 3) that it did not suddenly fly off as soon as i had seen it. 4) that it was flying across a major population area, a major city. from it's line of travel it must have flown straight over the top of the observatory at toowong, and also the university of queensland. 5) that traffic did not come to a screetching halt 6) that i myself, in spite of seeing something that crashed against my ideas of reality and everyone's ideas of physics, just simply was so casual about it. i didn't tell anyone. all my thoughts about what i had seen became sort of anaesthetised in a sense. 7) then as i watched it "float" silently overhead, as if to accentuate the fact that it was real, and was a single object, it slowly rolled over in the sky as it flew. it looked like it rolled, but it might also have been folding its leading edges toward its spine. it was so matt black i couldn't make out any detail other than its triangle shape. and i could only see its shape, really, by the acres of stars that it was blotting out above it. i would guess it was travelling at a height of about 1500 feet to maybe 2500 feet. it felt close. oh... and i can't remember how i lost sight of it. that is point number 8.
